intro: Eriocaulon dianae var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered rice sedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, arranged in spikelets. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
